Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different types of habitats, one on land and one in water (e.g., a forest and a pond).
The student can draw and identify at least two types of plants in each habitat (e.g., trees and grasses in a forest, aquatic plants in a pond).
The student can draw and identify at least two types of animals in each habitat (e.g., squirrels and birds in a forest, fish and clams in a pond).
The student can compare the different types of plants and animals living in the land habitat to those in the water habitat through their drawing.
The student can use their observations to show patterns in plant and animal diversity between the two habitats.
